HomePage.title: Welcome to TerraNostra
HomePage.description: Empowering communities through regenerative practices and ecological education.
HomePage.heroTitle: Designing for Wellbeing, Inspired by Nature
HomePage.heroSubtitle: We create sustainable and regenerative systems for personal, community, and planetary well-being.
HomePage.whatWeDoSubtitle: We offer a range of projects, products, and services to help you live more sustainably.
HomePage.projectsDescription: Design and implementation of regenerative vegetable garden, rain gardens, pollinator gardens, and more.
HomePage.productsDescription: Native plants, seeds, compost, and natural cosmetics to support your sustainable lifestyle.
HomePage.servicesDescription: Consulting, workshops, and courses on permaculture, agroecology, and sustainable development.
HomePage.howWeWorkSubtitle: Our work is based on a combination of science, art, and heart.
HomePage.scienceDescription: Our designs are based on permaculture, naturalist landscaping, and agroecology.
HomePage.systemsDescription: We create living spaces that are in harmony with nature and support your well-being.
HomePage.praxisDescription: We believe in learning by doing and sharing our knowledge to create deep changes in our ways of life.
HomePage.benefitsSubtitle: Our projects and services are designed to bring a range of benefits to you, your community, and the planet.
HomePage.benefit1Description: Access to fresh, organic food from your own garden.
HomePage.benefit2Description: Spaces for relaxation, reflection, and connection with nature.
HomePage.benefit3Description: Strengthening community ties through shared work and learning.
HomePage.benefit4Description: Restoring ecosystems, improving soil health, and managing water efficiently.
HomePage.whatCanBeDoneSubtitle: Our work can be applied in a variety of contexts, from small gardens to large-scale projects.
HomePage.clientsSubtitle: We are proud to work with a diverse range of clients and partners.
HomePage.testimonialsSubtitle: See how we've turned ordinary grass patches into thriving, living ecosystems
HomePage.testimonialValeStory: Our backyard was just grass and concrete. Now it's a living ecosystem with herbs, flowers, and life everywhere. The transformation is incredible!
HomePage.testimonialValeBeforeAfter: From barren grass to thriving biodiversity
HomePage.testimonialTaniaStory: What was once a lifeless patch of grass is now our family's favorite place. We grow our own food and the kids love watching butterflies visit our garden.
HomePage.testimonialTaniaBeforeAfter: From empty lawn to family sanctuary
HomePage.ctaSubtitle: Let's work together to create a more sustainable future.

AboutPage.title: About Us
AboutPage.description: TerraNostra is dedicated to empowering communities through regenerative practices and ecological education.
AboutPage.ourMissionDescription: We believe in the power of regenerative practices to heal our planet and ourselves. Our mission is to empower individuals and communities with the knowledge and tools to create a more sustainable and abundant future.
AboutPage.ourStorySubtitle: From a shared vision to a collective reality
AboutPage.ourStoryDescription: TerraNostra was born from a shared passion for nature and a desire to make a positive impact. What started as a small community garden has grown into a thriving ecosystem of projects, products, and services that are helping to create a more sustainable world.
AboutPage.caroBio1: I'm Carolina Lara, I studied Ecology and later specialized in natural resource management and rural development. For many years I worked in rural communities on projects related to land use change and territorial and landscape planning, as well as some productive projects.
AboutPage.caroBio2: Later, I had the opportunity to take a course on organic agriculture and permaculture that completely changed my professional and personal perspective. It allowed me to realize the system we live in and above all to reflect on our life model, the food production system, contact with nature and the relationship between our self-care and caring for the planet.
AboutPage.caroBio3: Currently, I dedicate myself to ecological design and complement it with tools such as coaching, seeking that designs take into account not only environmental conditions but also the needs and interests of users, and that the benefits of a garden or green area are environmentally sustainable and generate benefits at the mental and emotional level.
AboutPage.adriBio1: Permaculture and political agroecology changed my life. First I studied sustainable development at Colmex in the LEAD program, then I worked at a well-known Mexican climate foundation and eventually I went to live in the countryside to plant and experiment with living in other ways.
AboutPage.adriBio2: I have made gardens, managing to feed up to 23 families each month, I have participated in the design and implementation of a couple of projects of 1 hectare or a little less, planting medicinal gardens, implementing greenhouses, seed houses, chicken coops, biofactories and more.
AboutPage.adriBio3: I believe that the fact that I have worked with the land for more than 10 years allows me to give a more grounded vision with greater experience, as well as better recommendations and results for anyone who wants to collaborate with us.
AboutPage.teamHeaderSubtitle: Meet the visionaries cultivating regenerative futures through ecological design and permaculture innovation.
AboutPage.philosophyText: We believe that regenerative design mimics nature's patterns, creating systems that heal the earth while nurturing human communities. Through permaculture principles and ecological innovation, we cultivate abundance that flows in harmony with natural cycles.

ProjectsPage.title: Our Projects
ProjectsPage.description: Discover our work in creating sustainable and regenerative systems.
ProjectsPage.project1Description: A diverse, edible ecosystem designed for abundance and resilience.
ProjectsPage.project2Description: A healing space filled with plants that nourish the body and soul.
ProjectsPage.project3Description: A vibrant haven for bees, butterflies, and other essential pollinators.
ProjectsPage.project4Description: Transforming organic waste into a valuable resource for soil health.
ProjectsPage.project5Description: Designing sustainable greenhouses and plant reproduction systems to maximize plant production and diversity.
ProjectsPage.project6Description: A productive vegetable garden that regenerates soil and enhances biodiversity.
ProjectsPage.designPhilosophyDescription1: The type of design we develop is supported by different sciences, knowledge and schools of thought such as permaculture, naturalistic landscaping and agroecology.
ProjectsPage.designPhilosophyDescription2: Each of them provides design principles that are based on caring for nature. Integrating biodiversity and native species, using organic fertilizers, regenerating soils, efficiently managing water, and generating landscapes that maintain ecosystem services and functions.
ProjectsPage.projectTypesTitle: What types of projects can we help you with

socioenvironmentalBenefits.educateBiodiversity: Educates about the importance of biodiversity
socioenvironmentalBenefits.createNaturalBeauty: Creates spaces of natural beauty in the community

detailedDescriptions.regenerativeHuerto: Regenerative garden system that restores soil health and promotes sustainable food production.
detailedDescriptions.pollinatorHabitat: Gardens specifically designed to attract and sustain pollinators, essential for food production.
detailedDescriptions.foodForest: Edible forests that mimic the natural structure of forest ecosystems to produce food sustainably.
detailedDescriptions.medicinalGarden: Specialized gardens in medicinal plants that combine ancestral wisdom with modern sustainable practices.
detailedDescriptions.compostingSystem: Composting systems that transform organic waste into valuable resources for soil fertilization.
detailedDescriptions.nurseryReproduction: Specialized nurseries in the reproduction and conservation of native plants and adapted local varieties.

permacultura.description: A comprehensive design system that seeks to create sustainable and ecologically healthy human settlements.

permacultura.fairShare: Fair Share: Distribute resources and surpluses equitably
permacultura.gardenDesign: Design of edible gardens and landscapes

paisajismo.title: Naturalistic Landscaping
paisajismo.description: Design of spaces that imitate and celebrate the beauty and functionality of natural ecosystems.
paisajismo.nativePlants: Use of native and adapted plants

agroecologia.title: Agroecology
agroecologia.description: Science that integrates ecological principles in the design and management of sustainable agricultural systems.

DesignPhilosophy.howWeApply: How do we apply {approach} in our projects?
DesignPhilosophy.howWeApplyDescription: Each project we develop integrates these principles holistically, adapting them to the specific conditions of the place and the needs of the community. Our team combines scientific knowledge with traditional wisdom to create solutions that are both ecologically healthy and socially just.

ServicesCatalog.title: Our Ecological Design & Permaculture Services
ServicesCatalog.subtitle: We offer a holistic suite of services to design, implement, and manage regenerative systems at any scale, from urban gardens to large rural landscapes.

items.title: Permaculture Design Master Plans
items.description: Conceptual and detailed design for farms, farms and communities, including zone and sector planning, water harvesting, food forests and integrated animal systems. Climate and microclimate assessment, topography and hydrology mapping, soil analysis, sun and shade patterns, existing vegetation and wildlife inventory, and resource inventory.

items.title: Regenerative Landscaping and Gardening
items.description: Design of edible landscapes, pollinator gardens and wildlife gardens, rain gardens, medicinal gardens and aromatic herb spirals.

items.title: Landscape-Scale Ecological Design
items.description: Watershed restoration planning, riparian zone rehabilitation, ecological corridor design, food forests, and agroforestry and silvopastoral systems.

education.title: II. Education, Training and Capacity Building

items.title: Tailored workshops and courses
items.description: Landscape design courses, permaculture, agroecology principles, garden design, gardens and various systems.

items.title: On-Site Demonstrations and Tours
items.description: Showcasing implemented projects as learning sites and practical skill-building sessions.

items.title: Mentorship Programs
items.description: Personalized guidance for landowners/farmers, focused on accompaniment in the design of their spaces or projects.

items.title: Educational Material Development
items.description: Custom guides, manuals, online courses, webinars and curriculum development for schools and communities.

items.title: Ecological Impact Monitoring
items.description: Tracking progress in soil health, biodiversity studies, water quality monitoring and carbon sequestration assessment.

items.title: System Performance Evaluation
items.description: Assessment of productivity, yield diversity, water system efficiency and economic viability.

items.title: Applied Research and Development
items.description: Design and management of field research trials, participatory action research and documentation of best practices.

productsCta.title: Need Plants, Seeds, or Natural Products?
productsCta.description: While designing your ideal ecosystem, remember that we also provide a curated selection of native seeds, robust plants, and organic products to bring your project to life.

SeedsSection.title: Premium Organic
SeedsSection.description: Discover our carefully curated selection of organic, heirloom, and traditional seeds. Each seed is selected for its quality, germination rate, and contribution to biodiversity.

organicSeeds.title: 100% Organic Seeds
organicSeeds.description: All our seeds are certified organic, ensuring they're free from synthetic chemicals and grown using sustainable practices.

germinationRate.title: High Germination Rate
germinationRate.description: We test every batch to ensure optimal germination rates, giving you the best start for your garden.

traditionalVarieties.title: Traditional Varieties
traditionalVarieties.description: Preserve biodiversity with our collection of heirloom and traditional seed varieties that have been passed down through generations.

catalog.title: Seed Catalog
catalog.description: Our comprehensive seed catalog is being updated with the latest varieties. Get notified when it's ready and receive exclusive early access.

PlantsSection.title: Native & Ecological
PlantsSection.description: Transform your space with our selection of native plants, ecological restoration species, and garden favorites. Each plant is chosen for its environmental benefits and beauty.

nativeSpecies.title: Native Species
nativeSpecies.description: Support local ecosystems with plants that are naturally adapted to your region's climate and soil conditions.

ecologicalRestoration.title: Ecological Restoration
ecologicalRestoration.description: Specialized plants for restoring degraded landscapes, improving soil health, and creating wildlife habitats.

acceleratedGrowth.title: Accelerated Growth
acceleratedGrowth.description: Our plants are grown using advanced techniques to ensure strong root development and rapid establishment.

catalog.title: Plants Catalog
catalog.description: Our comprehensive plants catalog is being updated with the latest varieties. Get notified when it's ready and receive exclusive early access.

EmailSubscription.title: Stay Updated
EmailSubscription.description: Subscribe to receive updates about our products, special offers, and gardening tips. We'll notify you as soon as our catalogs are ready!
